column3: rebased. It'd be really helpful to get this merged so we can make some progress on #10082 . This is the only disruptive changeset in that larger PR - the rest of the changes are restricted to the test_framework directory.\n\nThis PR touches a lot of files, but it should be a trivial review. It's simply changing calls from `stop_node()` to calls to `self.stop_node()` etc wrapper functions in the
Tested, ACK a433d8a15e165cfb42e44319d608365603f64e0c\n\nA couple of really small nits. Excited to keep this moving!
Thanks @ryanofsky @jimmysong @kallewoof . Nits fixed in fixup commit. Will squash when this is ready for merge.
The plan is to change `start_node` so assignment here would be unnecessary in the future?
Not sure why this was added?
I assume that `self.start_nodes` would also do the assignment in the future?
Nit: I personally like comma endings so adding new imports has cleaner diffs.
Maybe move these up one line so nodes[1].encrypt and pop(1) can be next to each other.
Unless it should be possible to append nodes.
yes. not sure how that snuck in. Reverted.
yes - that's certainly something we can do in a future PR once the BitcoinTestFramework class is responsible for tracking and stop/starting the nodes.

certainly something we can do in a future PR.\n\nBitcoinTestFramework could include two functions - `start_nodes()` to start the nodes in `self.nodes`, and `add_nodes()` if you need to append nodes to that list.
